de.affect.appraisal.eec

Class Realization

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.affect.appraisal.eec.Realization

  • public class Realization
extends java.lang.Object
    The Realization class reflects the status of an anticipated event. The status of an event depends not upon the actual occurrence or nonoccurrence of the prospective event, but on the experiencing agent's beliefs about such occurrences.
    The agent may believe that the event has occurred (labeled "confirmed"), or the agent may believe that the event failed to occur ("disconfirmed"). The Realization class also reflects the degree to which the confirmed or disconfirmed event is realized.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Gebhard (based on the work of Martin Klesen)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Realization(double degree)
      Returns a new Realization object using the specified value to describe the degree to which the confirmed or disconfirmed event is realized.

      Returns the degree to which the event is realized.
      boolean isConfirmed()
      Returns true if the event has occurred and false the event failed to occur.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Realization

        public Realization(double degree)
        Returns a new Realization object using the specified value to describe the degree to which the confirmed or disconfirmed event is realized.
        Parameters:
        degree - the degree to which the event is realized. A negative degree denotes disconfirmend of an event.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the degree is not a real number in the interval [-1.0,1.0].
